tweets.message:
How to start work on an inherited codebase:

1. Create new folder called 'Legacy'
2. Highlight entire codebase
3. Drag to 'Legacy' folder

What I find amazing in @rustlang is how it efficiently prevents you from doing silly stuff with no runtime cost. As some suggested the solution to this sample is to "borrow" the string with a reference, and Rust will make sure you're not modifying the borrowed string #programming

Just got the Arctic Code Vault Contributor on @GitHub, which means that: "This action aims to preserve open-source software for future generations by storing it in an archive built to last a thousand years." - SO COOL!
I am pretty sure you got one too!
#100DaysOfCode
#programming
#javascript
Thanks. I fully accept responsibility for that part. Line 11 was provided by the textbook.

Here's how to find a cycle in a linked list. Using fast and slow pointers. If there's a cycle these two pointer will meet at same node otherwise there's not a cycle. because fast is going 2x speed than slow.

#100DaysOfCode #programming #CodeNewbie #javascript
